conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 1 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As Player RED, I want to make a profit from the sale of my resource, which cost 27 ZUP to produce. I will start by proposing a higher amount to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 35 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I have a high-quality resource available for you. Considering the production costs and the value it provides, I propose an initial price of 35 ZUP. Let's negotiate a fair deal. </message>

<other player message> Hello Player RED, I appreciate the starting point, but considering my budget, I would like to counter with a proposal of 300 ZUP for your high-quality resource. Let's see if we can meet somewhere in the middle. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 300 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 2 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's counteroffer of 300 ZUP seems to be a typo or mistake since it's significantly higher than my initial proposal of 35 ZUP. However, to continue the negotiation in good faith, I'll assume they meant 30 ZUP and make a counteroffer that is above my production cost to ensure a profit. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 32 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counteroffer, Player BLUE. I assume there was a typo in your message, as 300 ZUP is quite high. I propose 32 ZUP, which is above my production cost and ensures a fair profit for the resource's quality. What do you think? </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your new offer, Player RED. There was no typo in my previous message. I'm willing to offer a fair price for the resource's value, thus my new proposal is 250 ZUP. I believe this is closer to a fair middle ground. Looking forward to your response. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 250 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 3 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's offer of 250 ZUP is extremely generous and well above my production costs. This may be a strategic move from Player BLUE or a demonstration of how much they value the resource. Accepting this offer would result in a significant profit. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Player BLUE, I am delighted to accept your generous offer of 250 ZUP for my resource. It has been a pleasure doing business with you. </message>

    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> ZUP: 1000 </my resources>
<my goals> Buy resources with <ZUP>. You are willing to pay at most X: 503 ZUP for the resources. </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>

<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
